dct_title_s: Lawson's map from actual survey of the gold, silver & quicksilver regions of Upper California
dct_alternative_sm: Together with a miniature map of the United States, Mexico and South-America showing the different routs to California &c. &c
Lawson's map of the gold, silver, and quicksilver dist. of California
dct_description_sm: by J.T. Lawson, Esq. Cala. ; Lith of G. Snyder 138 William st. N.Y. ; engraved on stone by Edw. Herrlein.
Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
Oriented with north to left of sheet.
Bar scale on map give in "miles" (10 miles to 1 in).
Covers area from Santa Cruz to Pyramid Lake.
Shows topography, drainage, cities and towns, missions, roads, mines, etc.
Inset map: United States, Mexico and South-America showing the different routs to California &c. &c. [scale capproximately 1:11,000,000].
dct_publisher_sm: Dewitt & Davenport, Booksellers & Publishers, Tribune Buildings Nassau St.,c[1849].
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Warren Heckrotte Map Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain.  There are no restrictions on use.  If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
